Articles.Content: I'm a physics student, who will start studying astrophysics in January. What do you study or work with?

I was touring with my band the past 7 years. It did not end well.

Right now I'm making a lot of excel files at my job.

I'm also studying computer engineering in late courses, after my work, to get a diploma and a better job .
I'm a photographer working a desk job for an industrial engineering company, like grawl making a lot of excel systems and illustrating whatever needs a mechanical drawing.

I'm a student studying computer science, currently on a placement year working as a software developer.

G.
I'm a microbiology student at uni.

I'm a microbiology student at uni.

Soon, this. At the moment, just a guy doing a lot of revising...
I'm a geography teacher
A student, riding on the highway to hell (GCSE exams). After that, I'll be doing my maths/science A-levels.
I work in the Nebraska Dept. of education. Pretty easy going as my boss only comes by the office every month or so. And i don't have to work with anyone

Engineer. I started out in a job where I was the guy who'd get called at all hours of the day to approve the repair that would "make it go" when the "ship" was broken. Now I develop firmware for control systems.

Edited May 29, 2013 by PakledHostage
You guys are all doing smart things... I'm nothing but a humble graphic design student. I did above average in school but nothing special.
I'm a mechanical engineer, I work in the design engineering depart of company that manufactures turbomachinery.
Still 15 so I don't really have an 'occupation' other than secondary school, but I'm strifing to go into the direction of aerospace engineering.
A historian with a specialization in the space race from the 1950's to the early 1980's

I really am not sure how to answer this. Have ... to many ... skills and ... degrees -.-

I went to a trade school for Telecommunications, I now have a degree for telecommunications and a certification for fiber optics.

I have gone to college 2 times, once for computer science, once for Video Game Art and Design.

I am working on getting my Cisco Certs.

Those are just areas I have schooling in. I have many skills that I didn't obtain through schooling but are self taught.

Web design (Started learning HTML around 12)

Graphic Design

Artist (Drawing, Painting, CG, etc.)

Computer Repair (Been repairing computers since I was 10 XD)

Electrician (I don't have my cert, so I can't legally use this skill, learned it in my Telecom classes)

Can't think of any others that could be considered as profession worthy. However as you can see, I have a ridiculous amount of skills to choose from lol. It makes sense when you get to know me. I tend to jump around learning different things never sticking to one thing. I sometimes will do certain things just to see if I can. I guess you could say my best skill is learning.
Electrical Engineer. I design, build and maintain diagnostic systems in a physics research facility investigating how to make fusion power a reality.
Physics Bachelor Student. Not much to say
Grad student in mechanical engineering, doing controls research. Lots of numerical optimization and programming, some theory, not so much mechanical anything recently.

I'm an astronomy lecturer for a company that brings a portable planetarium and telescopes to schools. We ride hundreds of kilometers across our country on a bus It's like being in a rock band, but your fans are kids and instead of playing music, you show them the universe

Soon, this. At the moment, just a guy doing a lot of revising...

Nice one! Don't you worry, you'll still be a guy doing a lot of revising when you're a micro student

I'm a student who's undergoing torturous studying on the highway to hellland. I've got Finals next week, and a ton of homework due, but screw that, let's play KSP. Other than that, no afterschool activites, except for an possible undergraduate internship with NASA.
as little as possible
I am chemist. Working as analyst (water and air quality) and as researcher (company's science department - non space related, some protein and spore isolation).
Yup, lots of smart people here I am but a humble carpenter, eking out a living in a small town
